main event: Multiple observations of unidentified flying objects were reported from Randolph Air Force Base in San Antonio, Texas on 2 February 1957 and 6 February 1957.
interesting points: The objects observed were described as 50-60 feet in diameter, round, and orange-red in color.
The objects moved in a straight line and disappeared at extreme altitude.
The observers included 2 officers, 2 airmen, and 3 F-84's in Randolph Flight (let-down) pattern.
The observers reported clear, warm, and dry weather conditions with no winds, little to no clouds, and 15-mile visibility.
Despite the observations, the official conclusion was that the objects were probably meteors, and there were no reported unusual aerial phenomena in the area.
sighted object: three unidentified objects, 50-60 feet in diameter, round, and orange-red in color
location: Randolph Air Force Base, San Antonio, Texas
witnesses: 2 officers, 2 airmen, and 3 F-84's in Randolph Flight
